Four big things next week:

⬆️ 2 million people on the National Living wage will get a pay rise
✂️ 31 million workers will get an income tax cut 
👵 12 million pensioners will get a boost to their state pension
🚗 Millions of drivers will see fuel duty frozen again

#PMQs

The number of people living absolute poverty in the UK has fallen by 600,000 since 2010. #PMQs

Whilst we’ve committed £1 billion through to 2020 to tackle rough sleeping and homelessness, we know it’s not only about money. That's why we’re changing how councils approach this issue to help more people get tailored support sooner when they’re at risk of homelessness. #PMQs

We pledged in our manifesto to halve rough sleeping by 2022 and eliminate it altogether by 2027. We’ve already committed £1 billion to help bring this about, and are piloting the Housing First approach in three of our great cities. #PMQs

Following today's #Vote100 speech in Manchester, the PM sets out why we need more women in public life. #100years https://t.co/1F9UjLo76D
A century on from the first votes for women, we can look back with pride on the enormous strides which we have taken as a society – PM #Vote100 #100years #StillMarching https://t.co/NAc7oOQpms

.@Theresa_May: ‘As the woman at the head of our government, a century after my grandmothers were given the right to vote, my mission is clear: build that better future for all our people - a country that works for everyone and a democracy in which every voice is heard.’ #Vote100 https://t.co/cr0IZNcmDj

We have taken enormous strides as a society, and must continue to protect our democracy and ensure social media is a force for good in public life, with a series of new steps – PM on #Vote100 #StillMarching #100years https://t.co/o3B2eiCBJ8

.@Theresa_May: "Each day in Downing Street when I pass the framed portraits of my 53 predecessors, 52 of whom were men, I focus not on what I can say but on what I can do to make our country a better place". #Vote100

.@Theresa_May: "At its best, British public life is characterised by the values which we have traditionally been most proud of as a nation. Fierce rivalry, yes, but also common decency. A rejection of extremism and absolutism". #Vote100

.@Theresa_May: "To address this challenge to our public debate, we will launch a review to examine the sustainability of our national and local press. A free press is one of the foundations on which our democracy is built and it must be preserved". #Vote100

.@Theresa_May: "Over 200 local papers have closed since 2005. This is dangerous for our democracy. When trusted and credible news sources decline, we can become vulnerable to news which is untrustworthy". #Vote100

.@Theresa_May: "Changes in technology are having a profound impact on one of the cornerstones of our public debate – our free press. Good quality journalism provides us with the information and analysis we need to inform our viewpoints and conduct a genuine discussion". #Vote100

.@Theresa_May: "In our universities, which should be bastions of free thought and expression, we have seen the efforts of politicians and academics to engage in open debate frustrated by an aggressive and intolerant minority". #Vote100 https://t.co/dOgZZoJ4uz

.@Theresa_May: "We will take action to make our electoral process more robust and offer greater protections for people taking part in elections. While intimidation is already a crime, we will consult on making it an offence in law to intimidate candidates". #Vote100

.@Theresa_May: ‘My Party has already put in place a new code of conduct which puts respect and decency at its core. We have proposed that the other parties follow us in signing a #RespectPledge for all campaigning. I hope that they will take us up on that suggestion.’ #Vote100

.@Theresa_May: ‘Social media – which can and should be a force for good in our democracy – are being exploited and abused, often anonymously. British democracy has always been robust and oppositional. But a line is crossed when disagreement mutates into intimidation.’ #Vote100
.@Theresa_May: ‘Today, the ideal of a truly plural and open public sphere where everyone can take part is in danger. A tone of bitterness and aggression has entered into our public debate.’ #Vote100
PM Theresa May on the suffrage movement as she marks #Vote100 during a speech in Manchester #100years #StillMarching https://t.co/AlhpOJpDLU
PM Theresa May speaks in Manchester on the enormous strides we have taken as a society over the past #100years for #Vote100 #StillMarching https://t.co/715MlPwLnY

In a speech to mark the centenary of women’s right to vote, the Prime Minister is celebrating the heroism of the suffrage movement which transformed British democracy #Vote100 #100years #StillMarching https://t.co/ksiTtm7sJD
.@Theresa_May: ‘Today, I am proud to serve as Britain’s second female prime minister in a Parliament with more female MPs than ever before.’ #Vote100 https://t.co/GDnACgFBod

.@Theresa_May: "The competition of ideas leading to collective progress and improvement. Respect for those with different viewpoints. These principles have been at the heart of the British tradition of liberty for generations". #Vote100

.@Theresa_May: "Britain’s liberal democracy has long been respected around the world for its tolerance and decency. It is defined by values which have a universal appeal. Freedom of thought and expression within laws which are democratically made" #Vote100

.@Theresa_May: "As @Conservatives Leader, and co-founder of @Women2Win, working to encourage women to stand for public office, I’m proud Emmeline Pankhurst was one of our pioneers, chosen as Conservative candidate for the Whitechapel & St Georges constituency in 1928". #Vote100
